intro: Mesembryanthemum rangei, commonly known as the Cape groundsel, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically blooms in spring and summer, producing vibrant yellow or orange flowers. Mesembryanthemum rangei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
